newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Right-wing fugitive bomber seized in South Africa.
newsitem.headline: Right-wing fugitive bomber seized in South Africa.

text.p: South African police on Tuesday arrested a second right-wing white wanted in connection with Christmas Eve bomb blasts that killed four blacks.
A police statement said Nicolaas Barnard was arrested on a farm in the arid Karoo region of Western Cape province. Police seized a number of handguns and rifles.

Barnard was among nine right-wingers convicted of murder last year for having planted bombs in and around Johannesburg that killed 20 people at the time of South Africa's first all-race election in April 1994. He and three others escaped from custody and have been on the run for nearly a year.
Police said Barnard and the two fellow escapees were also wanted for questioning about the Christmas Eve pipe bomb blasts in the farming town of Worcester northeast of Cape Town.
One of the three was arrested earlier this month on a farm near Johannesburg.
